{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Creative Content Designer",
  "description": "TheHRHive - Our client,&nbsp;Atinudah is a storytelling-driven creative company that crafts unforgettable experiences across branding, events, and content. Their work spans high-impact campaigns, immersive experiences, and creator-led content that shapes culture and community. They move fast, think big, and execute boldly.

They&nbsp;are building a world-class creative team, one that blends design, production, and strategy. If you dream in visual systems, think in timelines, and love translating ideas into impact, Atinudah is your canvas.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Content Designer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

About the Role


	We&rsquo;re looking for a highly creative, multi-skilled Content Designer to support our graphics, content, and social media teams with bold, engaging visual assets.
	This is not a traditional graphic design role - it&rsquo;s a hybrid for someone who&rsquo;s fluent in Canva, confident in Adobe Creative Suite, and obsessed with creating content that pops across formats - static, motion, and video.
	You&rsquo;ll be responsible for turning raw ideas into polished visual stories - from animated Instagram carousels to short-form video edits, branded decks, interactive content, and more.
	If you know how to work fast, think visually, and elevate brand presence through scroll-stopping content, this is the role for you.


Key Responsibilities
Content Creation &amp; Design:


	Design visually compelling social graphics, campaign assets, decks, templates, and event visuals.
	Work confidently in Canva and Adobe tools to create content that&rsquo;s brand-aligned, engaging, and on-trend.
	Support the graphics team in resizing, repurposing, and adapting visual assets for multiple platforms.


Video Production &amp; Editing:


	Maintain visual consistency across projects by adhering to brand guidelines and creative direction.
	Edit short &amp; long-form videos, reels, TikToks, and motion graphics for digital and social platforms.
	Collaborate on basic storyboarding, cuts, transitions, subtitles, and video structure.
	Add motion elements, music, pacing, and polish to make content dynamic and memorable.


Creative Storytelling &amp; Brand Alignment:


	Translate creative briefs into scroll-worthy content and social-first visuals.
	Help maintain a consistent brand tone across all formats (visual, motion, video).
	Support marketing campaigns with strong content ideas and flexible design execution.


Collaboration &amp; Execution:


	Work cross-functionally with creative, content, marketing, and social teams to deliver assets on time.
	Receive and apply feedback quickly, maintaining design quality and brand standards.
	Manage multiple content design projects simultaneously while staying organized.


Innovation &amp; Trendspotting:


	Research and apply the latest social media, design, and video trends.
	Suggest new formats (e.g., carousels, cinemagraphs, animated GIFs) and experiment with emerging tools&bull;
	Be a creative voice on how to keep Atinudah&rsquo;s content relevant and resonant.


Requirements


	1 - 3 years of content design or multimedia design experience (internship, freelance, studio, or personal brand work)
	Strong portfolio showing versatility in static graphics, social content, decks, video, and motion.


Proficiency in:


	Canva (required &ndash; very proficient)
	Adobe Creative Suite &ndash; especially Illustrator, Photoshop, and either Premiere Pro or After Effects
	Experience with CapCut, Final Cut, or other short-form video tools
	A strong sense of visual hierarchy, brand alignment, typography, and content pacing.
	Experience designing content for TikTok, Instagram Reels, LinkedIn, or YouTube Shorts
	Attention to detail and an ability to creatively adapt content to different formats and dimensions.
	Excellent communication and file organization skills in a remote-first environment.
	A proactive, curious, and self-managed attitude, you don&rsquo;t wait for inspiration or instructions.


Bonus If You Bring:


	Motion graphics skills in After Effects or equivalent
	Experience designing content for TikTok, Instagram Reels, LinkedIn, or YouTube Shorts
	Basic photography or mobile content creation skills
	Familiarity with influencer content formats and branded storytelling
	Exposure to event branding or activation design (banners, backdrops, digital signage).


Salary
Competitive.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;thehrhive@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.&nbsp;",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-03",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-10",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "HR Hive"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "value": "186810"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Creative Content Designer Job at HR Hive




        
    

        
        TheHRHive - Our client, Atinudah is a storytelling-driven creative company that crafts unforgettable experiences across branding, events, and content. Their work spans high-impact campaigns, immersive experiences, and creator-led content that shapes culture and community. They move fast, think big, and execute boldly.

They are building a world-class creative team, one that blends design, production, and strategy. If you dream in visual systems, think in timelines, and love translating ideas into impact, Atinudah is your canvas.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Creative Content Designer 

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract
     

            
    



About the Role


	We’re looking for a highly creative, multi-skilled Content Designer to support our graphics, content, and social media teams with bold, engaging visual assets.
	This is not a traditional graphic design role - it’s a hybrid for someone who’s fluent in Canva, confident in Adobe Creative Suite, and obsessed with creating content that pops across formats - static, motion, and video.
	You’ll be responsible for turning raw ideas into polished visual stories - from animated Instagram carousels to short-form video edits, branded decks, interactive content, and more.
	If you know how to work fast, think visually, and elevate brand presence through scroll-stopping content, this is the role for you.


Key Responsibilities
Content Creation & Design:


	Design visually compelling social graphics, campaign assets, decks, templates, and event visuals.
	Work confidently in Canva and Adobe tools to create content that’s brand-aligned, engaging, and on-trend.
	Support the graphics team in resizing, repurposing, and adapting visual assets for multiple platforms.


Video Production & Editing:


	Maintain visual consistency across projects by adhering to brand guidelines and creative direction.
	Edit short & long-form videos, reels, TikToks, and motion graphics for digital and social platforms.
	Collaborate on basic storyboarding, cuts, transitions, subtitles, and video structure.
	Add motion elements, music, pacing, and polish to make content dynamic and memorable.


Creative Storytelling & Brand Alignment:


	Translate creative briefs into scroll-worthy content and social-first visuals.
	Help maintain a consistent brand tone across all formats (visual, motion, video).
	Support marketing campaigns with strong content ideas and flexible design execution.


Collaboration & Execution:


	Work cross-functionally with creative, content, marketing, and social teams to deliver assets on time.
	Receive and apply feedback quickly, maintaining design quality and brand standards.
	Manage multiple content design projects simultaneously while staying organized.


Innovation & Trendspotting:


	Research and apply the latest social media, design, and video trends.
	Suggest new formats (e.g., carousels, cinemagraphs, animated GIFs) and experiment with emerging tools•
	Be a creative voice on how to keep Atinudah’s content relevant and resonant.


Requirements


	1 - 3 years of content design or multimedia design experience (internship, freelance, studio, or personal brand work)
	Strong portfolio showing versatility in static graphics, social content, decks, video, and motion.


Proficiency in:


	Canva (required – very proficient)
	Adobe Creative Suite – especially Illustrator, Photoshop, and either Premiere Pro or After Effects
	Experience with CapCut, Final Cut, or other short-form video tools
	A strong sense of visual hierarchy, brand alignment, typography, and content pacing.
	Experience designing content for TikTok, Instagram Reels, LinkedIn, or YouTube Shorts
	Attention to detail and an ability to creatively adapt content to different formats and dimensions.
	Excellent communication and file organization skills in a remote-first environment.
	A proactive, curious, and self-managed attitude, you don’t wait for inspiration or instructions.


Bonus If You Bring:


	Motion graphics skills in After Effects or equivalent
	Experience designing content for TikTok, Instagram Reels, LinkedIn, or YouTube Shorts
	Basic photography or mobile content creation skills
	Familiarity with influencer content formats and branded storytelling
	Exposure to event branding or activation design (banners, backdrops, digital signage).


Salary
Competitive.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: thehrhive@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Officer",
  "description": "PC Place Nigeria is a leading ICT retail and B2B solutions provider dedicated to delivering top-quality technology products and services across Nigeria. Established with a vision to bridge the gap between people and technology, we specialize in the supply of laptops, desktops, printers, accessories, networking equipment, and enterprise IT solutions to individuals, corporate clients, and institutions nationwide.

With a strong presence in Lagos and a growing footprint across the country, PC Place Nigeria has become a trusted name known for authentic products, competitive pricing, and excellent after-sales support.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	PC Place Nigeria is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Procurement Officer to join our growing team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing, negotiating, and procuring ICT equipment and services to meet our customer and internal demands, ensuring best value and timely delivery.
	You will work closely with sales, logistics, and vendor teams to streamline our supply chain process.


Key Responsibilities


	Source suppliers/vendors for laptops, tech products, and ICT-related equipment.
	Negotiate pricing, credit terms, and delivery schedules.
	Process purchase requisitions and maintain accurate records of procurement activities.
	Evaluate vendor performance and ensure compliance with quality standards.
	Monitor stock levels and coordinate with the inventory team.
	Prepare and issue Purchase Orders (POs) and ensure timely deliveries.
	Maintain strong relationships with OEMs, wholesalers, and distributors.
	Keep up with market trends and product pricing.
	Assist in maintaining procurement documentation and contracts.
	Work with the finance team on payment follow-ups and supplier account reconciliation.
	Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and procedures.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 2 - 6 years of work experience
	Strong negotiation and analytical skills.
	Solid knowledge of ICT hardware, laptops, accessories, and consumer electronics.
	Familiarity with vendor management and product sourcing.
	Excellent communication and organizational abilities.
	Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and basic procurement software.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified&nbsp;candidates should send their CV and &nbsp;a brief Cover Letter to:&nbsp;pcplacenigeria@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-03",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "PC Place Nigeria"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "value": "186809"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",

      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Procurement Officer Job at PC Place Nigeria




        
    

        
        PC Place Nigeria is a leading ICT retail and B2B solutions provider dedicated to delivering top-quality technology products and services across Nigeria. Established with a vision to bridge the gap between people and technology, we specialize in the supply of laptops, desktops, printers, accessories, networking equipment, and enterprise IT solutions to individuals, corporate clients, and institutions nationwide.

With a strong presence in Lagos and a growing footprint across the country, PC Place Nigeria has become a trusted name known for authentic products, competitive pricing, and excellent after-sales support.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	PC Place Nigeria is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Procurement Officer to join our growing team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for sourcing, negotiating, and procuring ICT equipment and services to meet our customer and internal demands, ensuring best value and timely delivery.
	You will work closely with sales, logistics, and vendor teams to streamline our supply chain process.


Key Responsibilities


	Source suppliers/vendors for laptops, tech products, and ICT-related equipment.
	Negotiate pricing, credit terms, and delivery schedules.
	Process purchase requisitions and maintain accurate records of procurement activities.
	Evaluate vendor performance and ensure compliance with quality standards.
	Monitor stock levels and coordinate with the inventory team.
	Prepare and issue Purchase Orders (POs) and ensure timely deliveries.
	Maintain strong relationships with OEMs, wholesalers, and distributors.
	Keep up with market trends and product pricing.
	Assist in maintaining procurement documentation and contracts.
	Work with the finance team on payment follow-ups and supplier account reconciliation.
	Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and procedures.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 2 - 6 years of work experience
	Strong negotiation and analytical skills.
	Solid knowledge of ICT hardware, laptops, accessories, and consumer electronics.
	Familiarity with vendor management and product sourcing.
	Excellent communication and organizational abilities.
	Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and basic procurement software.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and  a brief Cover Letter to: pcplacenigeria@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Carbon has operations in Ghana, Kenya, and Nigeria, supported by a talented team spread between Lagos, Nairobi, London, Argentina, and Palo Alto so we operate with a remote-first mindset.&nbsp;

SME Business Development Officer Job at Carbon Nigeria




        
    

        
        Carbon is a pan-African digital bank with a mission to provide friction-free finance to its customers. Carbon promises to play a fundamental role in its customers’ lives wherever they are, with flexible solutions. We pride ourselves on our efficiency and with just $10mm of equity raised in 2015, we have disbursed over $100m in loans and earned more than $30mm in revenue over the last 2 years. Carbon has operations in Ghana, Kenya, and Nigeria, supported by a talented team spread between Lagos, Nairobi, London, Argentina, and Palo Alto so we operate with a remote-first mindset. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below

Job Position: SME Business Development Officer
     

            
    



Job Locations: Abuja, Calabar - Cross River, Warri - Delta, Lagos and Port Harcourt - Rivers 

Experience Required


	2–5 years of proven success in sales, business development, or financial services.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Telesales Manager",
  "description": "Carbon is a pan-African digital bank with a mission to provide friction-free finance to its customers. Carbon promises to play a fundamental role in its customers&rsquo; lives wherever they are, with flexible solutions. We pride ourselves on our efficiency and with just $10mm of equity raised in 2015, we have disbursed over $100m in loans and earned more than $30mm in revenue over the last 2 years. Carbon has operations in Ghana, Kenya, and Nigeria, supported by a talented team spread between Lagos, Nairobi, London, Argentina, and Palo Alto so we operate with a remote-first mindset.&nbsp;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Telesales Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are looking for an experienced Telesales Manager (Lending)&nbsp; to lead our telesales team and drive revenue growth.
	If you have strong sales leadership skills, a passion for building high-performing teams, and experience in financial services, we&rsquo;d like to meet you.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 4-6 years in telesales or sales management (with 2+ years in leadership) within financial services.
	You might be the right person.

Telesales Manager Job at Carbon Nigeria




        
    

        
        Carbon is a pan-African digital bank with a mission to provide friction-free finance to its customers. Carbon promises to play a fundamental role in its customers’ lives wherever they are, with flexible solutions. We pride ourselves on our efficiency and with just $10mm of equity raised in 2015, we have disbursed over $100m in loans and earned more than $30mm in revenue over the last 2 years. Carbon has operations in Ghana, Kenya, and Nigeria, supported by a talented team spread between Lagos, Nairobi, London, Argentina, and Palo Alto so we operate with a remote-first mindset. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Telesales Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time
     

            
    



About the Role


	We are looking for an experienced Telesales Manager (Lending)  to lead our telesales team and drive revenue growth.
	If you have strong sales leadership skills, a passion for building high-performing teams, and experience in financial services, we’d like to meet you.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 4-6 years in telesales or sales management (with 2+ years in leadership) within financial services.
	You might be the right person.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Video Editor",
  "description": "Codelabprojects Nigeria Limited is a tech Company offering a range of digital solutions and services tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients. Our services include Web and Mobile Application Development, Business and IT Solutions, Digital Marketing, Search Engine Optimization, Website/E-commerce, Branding and Print solutions, among others.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Video Editor

Job Location:&nbsp;Sabon-Lugbe, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Job Summary


	We are looking for a passionate and skilled Video Editor to join our team and help bring our visual content to life.
	The ideal candidate will have a blend of creative expertise, technical skills, and an eye for detail, creating high-quality video content for both online and offline platforms.


Responsibilities


	Design engaging visual content for marketing materials, social media, websites, advertisements, and presentations.
	Create high-quality, visually compelling videos from start to finish, including filming, editing, and post-production.
	Collaborate with the marketing and creative teams to align visual content with company branding and messaging.
	Edit raw footage into polished final products that meet the needs of the project, ensuring quality and consistency.
	Maintain and organize digital assets for easy retrieval and reuse.
	Stay up to date with industry trends and software advancements to continuously improve video editing skills.
	Work on multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and project requirements.
	Collaborate with marketing and design teams to translate campaign objectives into impactful video content.
	Create motion graphics, animated text, and other visual effects to enhance storytelling.
	Maintain brand consistency across all video outputs.
	Stay updated with the latest editing software, tools, and industry trends to keep content modern and engaging.
	Organize and manage digital assets, ensuring proper storage, versioning, and accessibility.
	Optimize videos for multiple platforms (YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok, website, etc.).
	Support live-streaming, webinars, and virtual event productions when required.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in any related field
	Proven experience as a Video Editor (portfolio required).
	Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere Pro, etc.).
	Strong knowledge of design principles, video production, and post-production workflows.
	Excellent attention to detail and creativity.
	Ability to work independently as well as part of a collaborative team.


Salary
N170,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@codelabprojects.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Kindly answer the following questions:
	
		Where do you stay?
		This is a full-time, on-site role. Are you comfortable?
	
	
	Only candidates who reside in Abuja (Lugbe, Airport Road, Galadimawa, and surrounding areas) will be considered for this role.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-03",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "CodeLabProjects Group(CLP)"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "186801"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Video Editor Job at Codelabprojects  Group(CLP)




        
    

        
        Codelabprojects Nigeria Limited is a tech Company offering a range of digital solutions and services tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients. Our services include Web and Mobile Application Development, Business and IT Solutions, Digital Marketing, Search Engine Optimization, Website/E-commerce, Branding and Print solutions, among others.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Video Editor

Job Location: Sabon-Lugbe, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a passionate and skilled Video Editor to join our team and help bring our visual content to life.
	The ideal candidate will have a blend of creative expertise, technical skills, and an eye for detail, creating high-quality video content for both online and offline platforms.


Responsibilities


	Design engaging visual content for marketing materials, social media, websites, advertisements, and presentations.
	Create high-quality, visually compelling videos from start to finish, including filming, editing, and post-production.
	Collaborate with the marketing and creative teams to align visual content with company branding and messaging.
	Edit raw footage into polished final products that meet the needs of the project, ensuring quality and consistency.
	Maintain and organize digital assets for easy retrieval and reuse.
	Stay up to date with industry trends and software advancements to continuously improve video editing skills.
	Work on multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines and project requirements.
	Collaborate with marketing and design teams to translate campaign objectives into impactful video content.
	Create motion graphics, animated text, and other visual effects to enhance storytelling.
	Maintain brand consistency across all video outputs.
	Stay updated with the latest editing software, tools, and industry trends to keep content modern and engaging.
	Organize and manage digital assets, ensuring proper storage, versioning, and accessibility.
	Optimize videos for multiple platforms (YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, TikTok, website, etc.).
	Support live-streaming, webinars, and virtual event productions when required.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in any related field
	Proven experience as a Video Editor (portfolio required).
	Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere Pro, etc.).
	Strong knowledge of design principles, video production, and post-production workflows.
	Excellent attention to detail and creativity.
	Ability to work independently as well as part of a collaborative team.


Salary
N170,000 / month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@codelabprojects.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Kindly answer the following questions:
	
		Where do you stay?
		This is a full-time, on-site role. Are you comfortable?
	
	
	Only candidates who reside in Abuja (Lugbe, Airport Road, Galadimawa, and surrounding areas) will be considered for this role.
